channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Coercive control: Male victims say they aren't believed
item.description: Craig says he was criticised and controlled, leaving him with post-traumatic stress disorder.

item.title: Child, 2, dies after Deeside incident, prompting investigation
item.description: The child died in hospital on Monday following an incident at a property on Saturday.

item.title: Staff shortages remain despite more out of work in Wales
item.description: The number of people out of work fell in the past three months but is still higher than last year.

item.title: Wrexham: Teenager charged over serious assault
item.description: Christopher Keenan has been charged with grievous bodily harm with intent following the attack.

item.title: Farmer calls for A494 speed limit changes following crashes
item.description: Kevin Peacock says several cars have crashed onto his property and wants the speed limit lowered.

item.title: Cardiff Airport announces Ryanair flights to Dublin
item.description: Ryanair will operate four weekly flights between the capital cities from 31 October.

item.title: Cardiff council says garden waste collection to be cut due to lack of drivers
item.description: Almost a quarter of the drivers needed are currently unavailable for work, a council says.

item.title: Porth Neigwl: More safety measures needed at site of beach death, says witness
item.description: A man who witnessed an unsuccessful attempt to save a man says more warnings are needed.

item.title: Afghanistan: Soldier's mum hopes his death was not in vain
item.description: Sarah Adams, whose son James Prosser was killed in Afghanistan in 2009, says she is "heartbroken".

item.title: Hollywood-style sign in Wrexham is a whodunnit
item.description: The sign was erected on the slag heap at Bersham Bank colliery tip over the weekend.

item.title: Milad Rouf: Medical student pleads guilty to Brighton acid attack
item.description: Milad Rouf, from Cardiff, threw sulphuric acid over a young doctor in Brighton in May.

item.title: Cardiff man, 19, admits raping woman in Bute park
item.description: Tyler Higgins is remanded in custody and is due to be sentenced next month.

item.title: CCTV catches moment car crashes off A494 on to farmer's land
item.description: A farmer's CCTV captures the moment a car crashes on the A494 onto his property.

item.title: Afghanistan: Three views from Wales as the Taliban take control of Kabul
item.description: As the Taliban take control of Afghanistan, people affected question whether it was worth it.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Rail staff face abuse enforcing mask rules
item.description: Passengers on trains in Wales must still wear a mask, unlike in England where it is only advised.

item.title: Covid-19: How many windows to keep open to cut virus build-up
item.description: Opening four windows at lower speeds and only two on the motorway is best, researchers say.

item.title: Reading: Teacher gets stories published after 46 years
item.description: Keith Godwin used to make up stories for his pupils in the 1970s, now they have been published.

item.title: Covid: Record north Wales visitors after 'challenging' 18 months
item.description: North Wales has experienced a record-breaking summer for visitors, a tourism association says.

item.title: One-Day Cup: Joe Cooke stars as Glamorgan beat Essex to reach final
item.description: Joe Cooke stars with bat and ball as Glamorgan beat Essex by five wickets to reach the final of the One-Day Cup.

item.title: Champions League: Swansea City aim to shock CSKA Moscow
item.description: Swansea City Ladies will fly the Welsh flag in the Champions League when they face CSKA Moscow in Limassol on Wednesday night.

item.title: Rob Page: Wales manager given free rein to add new assistant
item.description: Wales manager Rob Page will add an assistant coach of his own choosing for World Cup qualifiers says FAW President Steve Williams.

item.title: Adran Leagues: FAW announces new identity for women's football in Wales
item.description: The Football Association of Wales has announced the restructured women's football pyramid will be known as the Adran Leagues.

item.title: Ethan Laird: Swansea City sign Manchester United defender on season-long loan
item.description: Swansea City sign Manchester United defender Ethan Laird on a season-long loan.

item.title: Rheolaeth drwy orfodaeth: Dynion yn diodde' hefyd
item.description: Yn ôl un cynllun sy'n gweithio gyda dioddefwyr gwrywaidd, dyw llawer o ddynion ddim yn cael eu credu.

item.title: Cynghorau i gynnig cartrefi i ffoaduriaid Afghanistan
item.description: Mae 10 allan o 22 awdurdod lleol yng Nghymru barod wedi cytuno i ddarparu lloches i bobl sy'n ffoi o'r wlad.

item.title: Wrecsam: Cyhuddo dyn o ymosodiad difrifol
item.description: Bydd dyn 19 oed yn mynd gerbron ynadon yn ddiweddarach wedi'i gyhuddo o anafu yn fwriadol.

item.title: Dysgu Cymraeg: Tips i siaradwyr newydd
item.description: Y tiwtor iaith Marian Brosschot sy'n rhannu cyngor ar sut i ymarfer dy Gymraeg dros y gwyliau.

item.title: Morgannwg drwodd i ffeinal y Cwpan Undydd ar ôl trechu Essex
item.description: Joe Cooke yn serennu gyda'r bat a'r bêl er mwyn llywio Morgannwg i rownd derfynol y Cwpan Undydd.
